Articles.Content:
Now, what can i do in carrier mode? What is your suggestion? Thanks:kiss:

Here s what i did:

Landed all jool moons

landed duna and duna's moon

landed kerbin's moons

I have an ISS in low orbit

If i go to other planets, it'll be waste of time. I have 5000 science point. I'm in 4th year.

Personally I've been playing KSP career mode with a second computer handy. It runs my spreadsheets that track what I've done, and my goal is to conduct all science options in all biomes, and return samples from all interesting places I can find that appear unique enough to identify beyond what biomes define.

It hasn't been about collecting science, it has been about placing challenges for myself and trying to meet them.

So far I'm failing miserably due to being out of practice, but I'm still usually having fun with it.

After you complete the tech tree, I guess it's basically sandbox. But you can still visit places to see ALL the science reports!

For SCIEN- Err, I mean... Because you CAN.
You could try to harvest all the science from the solar system, even though you don't need any of it any longer.

Restart with the mission control mod for for more to do.

Restart and only unlock one tech tree node per successful mission. (I'm doing this and it's very fun. I'm finding it a unique challenge).

Or if you're crazy, do both at the same time
Plant flags on all planets and moons. Return all Kerbals back home from there.
Gather all science from ksp (uncontrolled shudder) massive mission that
Unlock all achievements of my... *cough* achievements mod *cough* (see signature)

Personally I've been playing KSP career mode with a second computer handy. It runs my spreadsheets that track what I've done, and my goal is to conduct all science options in all biomes, and return samples from all interesting places I can find that appear unique enough to identify beyond what biomes define.

That... is such an awesome idea.
Cover every planet and moon in masses of flags.
Build a space plane that can take off from Kerbin, fly to Laythe, land and return. Include all science gear and 3 Kerbals for extra challenge.
